00022 /**
00023  * @file   MedNormTran.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Fri Oct 21 18:40:14 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief  Class for doing median, or average, normalization
00028  */
00029 #ifndef _MEDNORMTRAN_H_
00030 #define _MEDNORMTRAN_H_
00031 
00032 //
00033 #include "chipstream/ChipStream.h"
00034 //
00035 #include "util/Convert.h"
00036 //
00037 #include <vector>
00038 //
00039 
00040 /// String describing median normalization algorithm
00041 #define MEDNORMSTR "med-norm"
00042 
00043 /**
00044  *  MedNormTran -  Class for doing median, or average, normalization
00045  */
00046 class MedNormTran : public ChipStream {
00047 
00048 public:
00049 
00050   /** 
00051    * Constructor
00052    * 
00053    * @param target - Value to set median or average value to.
00054    * @param doAverage - Do average instead of median.
00055    * @param calcTarget - Calculate target as average or median of all data.
00056    * @param lowPrecision - Should we pretend like this got wrote to a cel file and 
00057    *                       read back again (meaning truncation)
00058    */
00059   MedNormTran(float target, bool doAverage, bool calcTarget, bool lowPrecision) ;
00060 
00061   /** 
00062    * @brief Only use a subset of all probes for normalization. For
00063    * example RMA only uses PM probes or might want to just use control
00064    * genes.
00065    * @param subsetProbes - bitmask indicating which probes to use for
00066    * normalization.
00067    */
00068   void setSubProbes(const std::vector<bool> &subsetProbes);
00069 
00070   /** 
00071    * @brief transform the intensity point supplied coming from a particular
00072    * probe in a particular microarray.
00073    * 
00074    * @param probeIx - Probe index from the cel file.
00075    * @param chipIx - Set of chip indexes from same sample.
00076    * @param intensity - Original intensities. 
00077    * @param return - transformed intensities.
00078    */
00079   float transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity);
00080 
00081   void transform(int chipIx, std::vector<float>& intensity);
00082 
00083   void newChip(std::vector<float> &data);
00084 
00085   /** 
00086    * @brief Method for being passed a new cel file worth of data.
00087    * @param data - Vector of vectors of cel file data from same sample.
00088    */  
00089   void newDataSet(IntensityMart* iMart);
00090 
00091   /** 
00092    * @brief Method for being passed a new cel file worth of data. Calculates
00093    * and stores the median (or average) of data supplied.
00094    * @param data - cel file vector of data.
00095    */  
00096   void initializeData(const std::vector<float> &data);
00097 
00098   /** 
00099    * @brief Signal that no more data is coming (i.e. newChip() will
00100    * not be called anymore. Currently the class builds up all the
00101    * summaries and figures out the normalization factores when this
00102    * function is called.  This makes it difficult to pass through data
00103    * to downstream.
00104    */
00105   void setTarget();
00106 
00107   void finishedChips() {
00108     setTarget();
00109   }
00110 
00111   /**
00112    * @brief Perform any necessary cleanup
00113    */
00114   void endDataSet();
00115 
00116   /** 
00117    * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00118    * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00119    */
00120   static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions();
00121 
00122   static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc);
00123 
00124   /** 
00125    * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00126    * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00127    * @return SelfDoc
00128    */
00129   static SelfDoc explainSelf();
00130 
00131   /** 
00132    * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00133    * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00134    * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00135    * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00136    * 
00137    * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00138    * 
00139    * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00140    */
00141   static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param);
00142 
00143 protected:
00144   /// Summary (median or average) for each chip seen.
00145   std::vector<double> m_Summary;
00146   /// Scale factore to multiply each chip by to get target
00147   std::vector<double> m_Scale;
00148   /// Bitmask indicating which probes to use for normalization
00149   std::vector<bool> m_SubProbes;
00150   /// Number of probes that will be used for normalization
00151   int m_SubProbeCount;
00152   /// What we want the summary for each chip to be.
00153   double m_TargetNorm;
00154   /// Do the average rather than the median.
00155   bool m_DoAverage;
00156   /// Has the target been set yet?
00157   bool m_TargetUnset;
00158   /// Should we mimic the truncation seen in normalized cel files?
00159   bool m_LowPrecision;
00160 };
00161 
00162 #endif /* _MEDNORMTRAN_H_ */
